GWAScopeR 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Determine the Number of Principal Components (PCs) Explaining a Given Variance Threshold

    varPCs.Rd

    This function performs Principal Component Analysis (PCA) on a genotype matrix (X) and determines the number of principal components that explain at least a specified proportion of the variance. The function handles missing values based on the `remove_NAs` parameter.

    varPCs(X, variance_threshold = 0.80, remove_NAs = FALSE)

    Arguments

    X

    A numeric matrix or data frame where columns represent SNPs (genotypes) and rows represent individuals. The values in the matrix should be coded as 0, 1, or 2 (for different genotypes) with potential NA values. The first column, if non-numeric, will be removed assuming it's an ID column.

    variance_threshold

    A numeric value between 0 and 1 indicating the proportion of the variance to explain using the principal components. Default is 0.80 (80

    remove_NAs

    A logical value. If `TRUE`, rows containing missing values (NA) will be removed from the matrix `X`. If `FALSE`, the function will stop if missing values are detected. Default is `FALSE`.

    Details

    This function performs PCA on the genotype data matrix `X` and calculates the proportion of variance explained by each principal component. It then returns the number of PCs that cumulatively explain the variance up to the `variance_threshold` specified.

    Value

    An integer indicating the number of principal components (PCs) that explain at least the specified variance threshold.

    References

    prcomp for performing PCA.

    Author

    Michelle Marcano-Delgado

    Note

    The input matrix `X` must have columns representing SNPs and rows representing individuals. The first column, if non-numeric, is assumed to be an ID column and is removed. Missing values can be handled based on the `remove_NAs` parameter.

    See also

    prcomp, complete.cases

    Examples

      # Example 1: Calculate the number of PCs that explain at least 80% of the variance
  # Assuming 'genotype_matrix' is a data frame or matrix of SNP genotypes
  num_PCs <- varPCs(genotype_matrix, variance_threshold = 0.80)
#> Error in varPCs(genotype_matrix, variance_threshold = 0.8): object 'genotype_matrix' not found

  # Example 2: Remove NAs before calculating the number of PCs
  num_PCs_no_NAs <- varPCs(genotype_matrix, variance_threshold = 0.80, remove_NAs = TRUE)
#> Error in varPCs(genotype_matrix, variance_threshold = 0.8, remove_NAs = TRUE): object 'genotype_matrix' not found
